content: Sung Min Hong - Faculty Profile Home Faculty Directory Profile Update Your Profile Directory FAQs PACT Login Give Feedback Sung Min Hong Assistant Professor Sung Min Hong Assistant Professor Academic Appointment(s)AdministrationDepartment of Computer & Cyber SciencesSchool of Computer and Cyber SciencesDepartment of Computer & Cyber Sciences BioAssistant Professor in the School of Computer and Cyber Sciences at Augusta University. Dr. Hong received a Ph.D. degree in Electrical & Computer Engineering from Texas A&M University. SUHONG@augusta.edu (706) 721-0506 RV1 2806 General Credentials Instruction Scholarship Education Ph.D., Computer Engineering, General Texas A&M University, 2023 Courses Taught Most Recent Academic Year CYBR 2600 Networking & Cyber Security CYBR 3200 Cyb Network Def & Counter Meas Teaching Interests Cybersecurity, computer science and engineering courses. Scholarship Selected Recent Publications Mew: Enabling large-scale and dynamic link-flooding defenses on programmable switches, 2023 Conference Proceeding SysFlow: Toward a programmable zero trust framework for system security, 2023 Journal Article, Academic Journal Attacking the brain: Races in the $\{$SDN$\}$ control plane, 2017 Conference Proceeding Bring Your Own Controller: Enabling Tenant-defined SDN Apps in IaaS Clouds, 2017 Conference Proceeding Enhancing Network Security through Software Defined Networking (SDN), 2016 Conference Proceeding Research Interests His research interests are computer system and network security including programmable security framework, Software Defined Networking (SDN), Zero Trust, IoT, and mobile device.
